# Templates Overview

Templates are reusable graphic designs that define the visual structure and animation of your broadcast graphics.

## What is a Template?

A template contains:
- **Elements** - Visual building blocks (text, images, shapes, etc.)
- **Layout** - Position and sizing of elements
- **Animations** - Motion for IN, LOOP, and OUT phases
- **Content Fields** - Editable areas for playout customization

## Template Structure

```
Template
├── Properties
│   ├── Name
│   ├── Width & Height
│   ├── Layer assignment
│   └── Duration settings
├── Elements
│   ├── Background shape
│   ├── Text elements
│   ├── Image elements
│   └── ... other elements
└── Animations
    ├── IN phase animations
    ├── LOOP phase animations
    └── OUT phase animations
```

## Template Types

### Lower Thirds

Name/title graphics at bottom of screen:
- Player names and positions
- Guest identifications
- Location information

### Full Screen

Graphics that fill the entire canvas:
- Title cards
- Statistics displays
- Sponsor messages

### Bugs

Small graphics typically in corners:
- Channel logos
- Score displays
- "Live" indicators

### Tickers

Scrolling information:
- News crawls
- Sports scores
- Weather alerts

## Creating Templates

See [Creating Templates](./creating) for detailed instructions.

## Template Management

### Organization

- Group templates by type/purpose
- Use consistent naming conventions
- Archive unused templates

### Versioning

- Duplicate before major changes
- Document template versions
- Keep backups of important templates
